sense.name: an outer, enclosing garment
sense.examples: Mary wore a chiffon wrap over her evening dress. The children left their wraps in the cloak room. The skirt is an ankle-length wrap of dark gray merino wool.

sense.name: a rolled up sandwich
sense.examples: John ordered a turkey club wrap for lunch. We enjoyed the Vietnamese lettuce wraps filled with spicy meat.

sense.name: enveloping cover made of flat material
sense.examples: Christmas wrap is on sale now at the drugstore. The doctor made a wrap of gauze and surgical tape around the injury. Mary went for a seaweed wrap and hot stone massage at the spa.

sense.name: termination of a performance session, e.g., a movie shoot
sense.examples: The director told the camera crew it was a wrap. The musicians were not yet ready to call it a wrap in the studio.

sense.name: a state of secrecy about something
sense.examples: The whole project was kept under wraps for quite some time. Details of the police operation are being kept under wraps.
